body.p: Cindy works for a competing accounting firm called “Ace Pro Accountants.” The hourly salary rate for accountants follow a normal distribution, with a mean of $24 and a standard deviation of $3. Cindy earns $18 an hour.
Whose salary is lower relative to his/her company’s mean salary: Tom or Cindy’s?

response.feedback: Incorrect. While it is true that Tom’'s hourly salary ($22.50) is higher than Cindy's ($18), it makes more sense to compare their z-scores. In other words, it would make more sense to compare their hourly salaries relative to other accountants in their respective companies. Try again.

Correct! Indeed, Cindy's z-score is -2, while Tom’s z-score is (22.50-27) / 4 = -1.125. Cindy’s hourly salary is lower, since she scored 2 standard deviations below the mean, while Tom scored only 1.125 standard deviations below the mean.

Incorrect. In order to decide which score is more impressive, compare the z-scores of both Tom's and Cindy’s hourly salaries. Bear in mind that each of the hourly salary rates come from a different normal distribution.

part.hint: Use z-scores to compare the relative position of the salaries.
